conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze how the liquid flows from points A, B, C, and D through the baffles and into containers E and F.
Point A liquid hits the vertical baffle directly below it.
The baffle deflects the liquid from point A towards the right side of the container.
The liquid from point A moves downward and is directed towards the right again by another baffle.
The liquid from point A eventually flows into container F.
Point B liquid hits a vertical baffle directly below it.
The baffle deflects the liquid from point B towards the left side of the container.
Another baffle further deflects the liquid from point B towards the right.
The liquid from point B flows into container F.
Point C liquid initially flows downward and hits a diagonal baffle.
The diagonal baffle deflects the liquid from point C towards the right.
The liquid from point C continues to move downward and is further directed towards the right by another baffle.
The liquid from point C ends up in container F.
Point D liquid initially flows downward and hits a vertical baffle.
The baffle deflects the liquid from point D towards the left.
Another baffle further deflects the liquid from point D towards the right.
The liquid from point D flows into container F.
The illustration shows liquid from points A, B, C, and D flowing through baffles and converging towards the right side of the container.
The streams of liquid are depicted as ending up in container F.
Based on analysis and confirmation from the illustration, all liquid from points A, B, C, and D ends up in container F.
